articles.title: Smith could replace Australia captain Marsh after 'testicular bleeding' injury
articles.summary: Steve Smith has been called up to Australia's T20 World Cup squad after current captain Mitchell Marsh was ruled out of their opening match with "testicular bleeding."

articles.title: England unravel at hands of West Indies spinners in T20 World Cup defeat
articles.summary: England suffered their first defeat of the T20 World Cup after a superb spell of spin bowling inspired the West Indies to a 30‑run victory in their Group C meeting in Mumbai.

articles.title: ‘We have got one more day’: Tilak shares big Abhishek, Bumrah fitness update
articles.summary: Tilak Varma provided positive fitness updates on Abhishek Sharma, who has been discharged from the hospital after a stomach infection, and Jasprit Bumrah, who is recovering well. Final decisions on their availability for the upcoming match against Namibia will be made closer to game time. The team is also preparing for their high-voltage encounter against Pakistan.
articles.author: TOI Sports Desk

articles.title: England captain Brook confident of Super 8 qualification despite West Indies loss
articles.summary: Harry Brook insisted England's Super 8 qualification hopes at the T20 World Cup were not dented by defeat to the West Indies.

articles.summary: Full fixtures for the 2026 Men's T20 World Cup in India and Sri Lanka, which is live in full on Sky Sports between February 7 and March 8.

articles.title: Heartbreak for Gurbaz and Afghanistan as South Africa win after double Super Over
articles.summary: Regulation time ended at 187-187; then we had 17-17 after the first Super Over; South Africa finally won the game after winning the second Super Over 23-19

articles.title: Chelsea Confidential: Why Blues are set to spend big in EVERY position this summer, latest on Marc Cucurella injury and the bizarre way Josh Acheampong could have stopped Leeds' controversial equaliser
articles.summary: Having lost out on Jeremy Jacquet, the 20-year-old centre back who signed a £60million pre-agreement with Liverpool late in the window, the Blues remain in the market for a defender.

articles.title: Umpire row costs Nabi as SA edge Afghanistan in double Super Over epic
articles.summary: Afghanistan all-rounder Mohammad Nabi has been fined. He received a 15 percent match fee penalty. This was for disobeying an umpire's instruction during the match against South Africa. The incident involved a dispute over a bowler's wristband. Nabi also received one demerit point. He accepted the sanction without a formal hearing. South Africa won the match after two Super Overs.
articles.author: TOI Sports Desk

articles.title: Smith called up as cover for Australia with Marsh injured for T20 World Cup opener
articles.summary: Smith last played a T20I in February 2024 but plundered 299 runs at 59.80 and a strike-rate of 167.97 in six innings for Sydney Sixers in the latest BBL

articles.title: T20 World Cup: Motie magic sinks England in Mumbai
articles.summary: England were bowled out for 166 in 19 overs in reply. They began the chase quickly, but Motie, who mixes left-arm orthodox and wrist spin, dismissed Tom Banton, Jacob Bethell and captain Harry Brook in a spell of 3 for 33.
articles.author: TOI Sports Desk

articles.title: IPL: Rajasthan Royals await BCCI nod on home games
articles.summary: Rajasthan Royals are hesitant to host majority of their home games at Jaipur's Sawai Mansingh Stadium due to unresolved safety and infrastructure concerns. The franchise has sought clarification from IPL and BCCI officials regarding the venue's adequacy for modern IPL matches. The stadium's outdated facilities and the Rajasthan Cricket Association's ongoing governance issues further complicate the situation.
articles.author: Mandakini Shalya

articles.title: Mouat bounces back as men's curling favourites GB start with win
articles.summary: Bruce Mouat recovers from his Winter Olympics curling mixed doubles disappointment in some style, leading his Team GB men's rink to a 9-4 victory in their opening match against China.

articles.title: Ellis, Zampa lead Australia to big win against Ireland
articles.summary: Ellis and Zampa picked up four-wicket hauls each to bowl Ireland out for 115 in chase of 183

articles.title: From ice hockey to T20 WC’s youngest talents: Ajayveer Hundal finds ‘great feeling’ in Delhi
articles.summary: Ajayveer Hundal, a 20-year-old Canadian cricketer, shares his journey from ice hockey to the sport's biggest stage. Born to Indian parents, Hundal discovered his love for cricket during the 2019 World Cup. He trained in India to hone his skills. Hundal now plays in the T20 World Cup, a dream come true.
articles.author: Jyotirmoy Halder

articles.title: ‘We are in match zone’: Tilak fires India-Pak warning ahead of T20 WC blockbuster
articles.summary: India batter Tilak Varma expressed excitement for the upcoming ICC Men's T20 World Cup clash against Pakistan on February 15, stating the team has entered "match zone" after fixture confirmation. Varma emphasised a methodical approach, focusing on one match at a time with video analysis and adapting to wicket conditions.

articles.title: Middle-overs stability: Spotlight on Tilak as India revisit T20 anchor debate before Namibia clash
articles.summary: Tilak Varma embraces the anchor role in India's T20 lineup, providing stability amidst explosive hitters.  He stressed the importance of the middle overs for winning T20 games, aiming to take the game deep and finish chases.  Learning from the USA slip-up, India prioritise a settled batting order, with Varma and Suryakumar key to this strategy.
articles.author: Arani Basu

articles.title: Death of a salesman, birth of a cricketer: How Usman Tariq became Pakistan’s X-factor
articles.summary: Pakistan's mystery spinner Usman Tariq, inspired by MS Dhoni, has become a significant threat ahead of the India clash. His unique slinging action and stop-start run-up have troubled batsmen, with R Ashwin and WV Raman defending his bowling style. Indian batters, however, are expected to adapt to the challenge posed by Tariq and Pakistan's other spinners.
articles.author: Dwaipayan Datta
